titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1076_01
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1076_01

encodingDesc.p: The original encoding was done in plain text files following the encoding quidelines of the Morgenländische Gesellschaft. With a dedicated web application these plain text files were transformed into XML documents validating (partially) against the Epidoc-Schema and those XML-Documents have been further sematically annotaded.
In order to avoid well known xml-issues especially in regards of overlapping elements the actual edited/annotated text was multiplied in several anonymos blocks, each block providing specific markup.

1.ʿAlhān Nahfān and his son Shāʿirum ʾAwtar, King of Sabaʾ [and Yar-] 2.im ʾAyman, King of Sabaʾ, have offered to their patron-god Taʾlab Riyāmum, [Lord of Tur- 3.ʿat, three statues of bronze out of gratitude because Taʾlab favored them 4.through granting all of the ṭyb-incense and ṣrf-incense which they had requested(?) and planted for the shrine

div.tei:ab:
ʿAlhān Nahfān and his son Shāʿirum ʾAwtar, King of Sabaʾ and Yar-
im ʾAyman, King of Sabaʾ, have offered to their patron-god Taʾlab Riyāmum, Lord of Tur-
ʿat, three statues of bronze out of gratitude because Taʾlab favored them
through granting all of the ṭyb-incense and ṣrf-incense which they had requested? and planted for the shrine

through granting all of the ṭyb-incense and ṣrf-incense which they had requested? and planted for the shrine
